refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The NiceAgent is your main object when using libnice. It is the agent that will take care of everything relating to ICE. It will take care of discovering your local candidates and do connectivity checks to create a stream of data between you and your peer.

example.title: Simple example on how to use libnice

refsect2.title: NiceAgent
refsect2.para: The NiceAgent is the main GObject of the libnice library and represents the ICE agent.

refsect2.title: enum NiceComponentState
refsect2.para:
An enum representing the state of a component.
See also: "component-state-changed"

listitem.simpara: No activity scheduled
Gathering local candidates
Establishing connectivity
At least one working candidate pair
ICE concluded, candidate pair selection is now final
Connectivity checks have been completed, but connectivity was not established
Dummy state

refsect2.title: enum NiceComponentType

listitem.simpara: RTP Component type
RTCP Component type

refsect2.title: enum NiceProxyType
refsect2.para:
An enum to specify which proxy type to use for relaying. Note that the proxies will only be used with TCP TURN relaying.
See also: "proxy-type"

listitem.simpara: Do not use a proxy
Use a SOCKS5 proxy
Use an HTTP proxy
Dummy last proxy type

refsect2.title: enum NiceCompatibility
refsect2.para: An enum to specify which compatible specifications the NiceAgent should use. Use with nice_agent_new()

listitem.simpara: Use compatibility for ICE Draft 19 specs
Use compatibility for Google Talk specs
Use compatibility for MSN Messenger specs
Use compatibility with Windows Live Messenger 2009
Dummy last compatibility mode

refsect2.title: NiceAgentRecvFunc ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*NiceAgentRecvFunc) (NiceAgent *agent, guint stream_id, guint component_id, guint len, gchar *buf, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Callback function when data is received on a component

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The id of the stream
The id of the component of the stream which received the data
The length of the data
The buffer containing the data received
The user data set in nice_agent_attach_recv()

refsect2.title: NICE_AGENT_MAX_REMOTE_CANDIDATES
refsect2.para: A hard limit for the number of remote candidates. This limit is enforced to protect against malevolent remote clients.

refsect2.title: nice_agent_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new NiceAgent. The returned object must be freed with g_object_unref()

listitem.simpara: The Glib Mainloop Context to use for timers
The compatibility mode of the agent
The new agent GObject

refsect2.title: nice_agent_add_local_address ()
refsect2.para: Add a local address from which to derive local host candidates

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The address to listen to If the port is 0, then a random port will be chosen by the system
TRUE on success, FALSE on fatal (memory allocation) errors

refsect2.title: nice_agent_add_stream ()
refsect2.para: Adds a data stream to agent containing n_components components.

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The number of components to add to the stream
The ID of the new stream, 0 on failure

refsect2.title: nice_agent_remove_stream ()
refsect2.para: Remove and free a previously created data stream from agent

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The ID of the stream to remove

refsect2.title: nice_agent_set_relay_info ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean nice_agent_set_relay_info (NiceAgent *agent, guint stream_id, guint component_id, const gchar *server_ip, guint server_port, const gchar *username, const gchar *password, NiceRelayType type);
refsect2.para: Sets the settings for using a relay server during the candidate discovery.

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The ID of the stream
The ID of the component
The IP address of the TURN server
The port of the TURN server
The TURN username to use for the allocate
The TURN password to use for the allocate
The type of relay to use
TRUE if the TURN settings were accepted. FALSE if the address was invalid.

refsect2.title: nice_agent_gather_candidates ()
refsect2.para: Start the candidate gathering process. Once done, "candidate-gathering-done" is called for the stream

note.para: Local addresses can be previously set with nice_agent_add_local_address()
If no local address was previously added, then the nice agent will automatically detect the local address using nice_interfaces_get_local_ips()

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The id of the stream to start

refsect2.title: nice_agent_set_remote_credentials ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean nice_agent_set_remote_credentials (NiceAgent *agent, guint stream_id, const gchar *ufrag, const gchar *pwd);
refsect2.para: Sets the remote credentials for stream stream_id.

note.para: Stream credentials do not override per-candidate credentials if set

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The ID of the stream
NULL-terminated string containing an ICE username fragment (length must be between 22 and 256 chars)
NULL-terminated string containing an ICE password (length must be between 4 and 256 chars)
TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: nice_agent_get_local_credentials ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean nice_agent_get_local_credentials (NiceAgent *agent, guint stream_id, gchar **ufrag, gchar **pwd);
refsect2.para: Gets the local credentials for stream stream_id.

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The ID of the stream
a pointer to a NULL-terminated string containing an ICE username fragment [OUT]. This string must be freed with g_free()
a pointer to a NULL-terminated string containing an ICE password [OUT] This string must be freed with g_free()
TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: nice_agent_set_remote_candidates ()
refsect2.programlisting: int nice_agent_set_remote_candidates (NiceAgent *agent, guint stream_id, guint component_id, const GSList *candidates);
refsect2.para: Sets, adds or updates the remote candidates for a component of a stream.

note.para: NICE_AGENT_MAX_REMOTE_CANDIDATES is the absolute maximum limit for remote candidates.
You must first call nice_agent_gather_candidates() and wait for the "candidate-gathering-done" signale before calling nice_agent_set_remote_candidates()

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The ID of the stream the candidates are for
The ID of the component the candidates are for
a GList of NiceCandidate items describing each candidate to add
The number of candidates added, negative on errors (memory allocation or if the local candidates are not done gathering yet)

refsect2.title: nice_agent_get_remote_candidates ()
refsect2.para: Get a list of the remote candidates set on a stream's component

note.para: The caller owns the returned GSList but not the candidates contained within it.
The list of remote candidates can change during processing. The client should register for the "new-remote-candidate" signal to get notified of new remote candidates.

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The ID of the stream
The ID of the component
a GSList of NiceCandidates objects representing the remote candidates set on the agent

refsect2.title: nice_agent_get_local_candidates ()
refsect2.para: Retreive from the agent the list of all local candidates for a stream's component

note.para: The caller owns the returned GSList as well as the candidates contained within it. To get full results, the client should wait for the "candidates-gathering-done" signal.

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The ID of the stream
The ID of the component
a GSList of NiceCandidate objects representing the local candidates of agent

refsect2.title: nice_agent_send ()
refsect2.programlisting: gint nice_agent_send (NiceAgent *agent, guint stream_id, guint component_id, guint len, const gchar *buf);
refsect2.para: Sends a data payload over a stream's component.

note.para: Component state MUST be NICE_COMPONENT_STATE_READY, or as a special case, in any state if component was in READY state before and was then restarted

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The ID of the stream to send to
The ID of the component to send to
The length of the buffer to send
The buffer of data to send
The number of bytes sent, or negative error code

refsect2.title: nice_agent_attach_recv ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean nice_agent_attach_recv (NiceAgent *agent, guint stream_id, guint component_id, GMainContext *ctx, NiceAgentRecvFunc func, gpointer data);
refsect2.para: Attaches the stream's component's sockets to the Glib Mainloop Context in order to be notified whenever data becomes available for a component.

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The ID of stream
The ID of the component
The Glib Mainloop Context to use for listening on the component
The callback function to be called when data is received on the stream's component
user data associated with the callback
TRUE on success, FALSE if the stream or component IDs are invalid.

refsect2.title: nice_agent_set_selected_pair ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean nice_agent_set_selected_pair (NiceAgent *agent, guint stream_id, guint component_id, const gchar *lfoundation, const gchar *rfoundation);
refsect2.para: Sets the selected candidate pair for media transmission for a given stream's component. Calling this function will disable all further ICE processing (connection check, state machine updates, etc). Note that keepalives will continue to be sent.

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The ID of the stream
The ID of the component
The local foundation of the candidate to use
The remote foundation of the candidate to use
TRUE on success, FALSE if the candidate pair cannot be found

refsect2.title: nice_agent_set_selected_remote_candidate ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean nice_agent_set_selected_remote_candidate (NiceAgent *agent, guint stream_id, guint component_id, NiceCandidate *candidate);
refsect2.para: Sets the selected remote candidate for media transmission for a given stream's component. This is used to force the selection of a specific remote candidate even when connectivity checks are failing (e.g. non-ICE compatible candidates). Calling this function will disable all further ICE processing (connection check, state machine updates, etc). Note that keepalives will continue to be sent.

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
The ID of the stream
The ID of the component
The NiceCandidate to select
TRUE on success, FALSE on failure

refsect2.title: nice_agent_restart ()
refsect2.para: Restarts the session as defined in ICE draft 19. This function needs to be called both when initiating (ICE spec section 9.1.1.1. "ICE Restarts"), as well as when reacting (spec section 9.2.1.1. "Detecting ICE Restart") to a restart.

listitem.simpara: The NiceAgent Object
TRUE on success FALSE on error

refsect2.title: The "compatibility" property
refsect2.para:
The Nice agent can work in various compatibility modes depending on what the application/peer needs.
See also: NiceCompatibility
Allowed values: <= 3
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "controlling-mode" property
refsect2.para: Whether the agent is in controlling mode.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "full-mode" property
refsect2.para: Whether agent runs in ICE full mode.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "main-context" property
refsect2.para: A GLib main context is needed for all timeouts used by libnice. This is a property being set by the nice_agent_new() call.

refsect2.title: The "max-connectivity-checks" property
refsect2.para: Upper limit for the total number of connectivity checks performed.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "proxy-ip" property
refsect2.para: The proxy server used to bypass a proxy firewall.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "proxy-password" property
refsect2.para: The password used to authenticate with the proxy.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "proxy-port" property
refsect2.para: The Proxy server used to bypass a proxy firewall.
Allowed values: [1,65536]
Default value: 1

refsect2.title: The "proxy-type" property
refsect2.para: The type of proxy set in the proxy-ip property.
Allowed values: <= 2
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "proxy-username" property
refsect2.para: The username used to authenticate with the proxy.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "stun-pacing-timer" property
refsect2.para: Timer 'Ta' (msecs) used in the IETF ICE specification for pacing candidate gathering and sending of connectivity checks.
Allowed values: >= 1
Default value: 20

refsect2.title: The "stun-server" property
refsect2.para: The STUN server used to obtain server-reflexive candidates.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "stun-server-port" property
refsect2.para: The STUN server used to obtain server-reflexive candidates.
Allowed values: [1,65536]
Default value: 1

refsect2.title: The "candidate-gathering-done" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (NiceAgent *stream_id, guint arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: This signal is fired whenever a stream has finished gathering its candidates after a call to nice_agent_gather_candidates()

listitem.simpara: The ID of the stream
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "component-state-changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (NiceAgent *stream_id, guint component_id, guint state, guint arg3, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: This signal is fired whenever a component's state changes

listitem.simpara: The ID of the stream
The ID of the component
The NiceComponentState of the component
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "initial-binding-request-received" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (NiceAgent *stream_id, guint arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: This signal is fired when we received our first binding request from the peer.

listitem.simpara: The ID of the stream
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "new-candidate" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (NiceAgent *stream_id, guint component_id, guint foundation, gchar *arg3, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para:
This signal is fired when the agent discovers a new candidate
See also: "candidates-gathering-done"

listitem.simpara: The ID of the stream
The ID of the component
The foundation of the new candidate
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "new-remote-candidate" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (NiceAgent *stream_id, guint component_id, guint foundation, gchar *arg3, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para:
This signal is fired when the agent discovers a new remote candidate. This can happen with peer reflexive candidates.
See also: "candidates-gathering-done"

listitem.simpara: The ID of the stream
The ID of the component
The foundation of the new candidate
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "new-selected-pair" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (NiceAgent *stream_id, guint component_id, guint lfoundation, gchar *rfoundation, gchar *arg4, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: This signal is fired once a candidate pair is selected for data transfer for a stream's component

listitem.simpara: The ID of the stream
The ID of the component
The local foundation of the selected candidate pair
The remote foundation of the selected candidate pair
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
